product: Kitchen Sink with Dual Waterfall Outlets,Digital Kitchen Sink with Cup Washer,Smart Sink with Pull-Out Faucet,Farmhouse Sink,304 Stainless Steel Kitchen Sink,Nano Kitchen Sink with All Accessories
text:
I knew going into this sink purchase that it was made for European/Asian specs.  As long as you know that and can logically find your own work-arounds, it is a beautiful sink!  The drain pipes are not US standard, nor is the display setting--it reads temperature in Celsius.  However, if you look at the few places that offer a standard US version, the prices are 2-3x higher.I did not find the bottom flimsy  (stated in a different review) and we were able to hook our old garbage disposal up to it.  The display is run by hydro-electric power, meaning that the water flowing through the faucet is literally what makes the display work.Most of the models similar to this one are the same way, so buyer beware.  Hope you find the sink that works for you!

text:
I have mix emotions.1. The tub:is super cheap, wobbly and flimsy. It wouldn't hold a garbage disposal.My Solution: sprayed bottom with a OLD SCHOOL liquid bedliner then enamel spray paint.  It harden up beautifully.Con: The size of the inserts are not correct so they slip out. Potential solution:  I'm going to get a hard plastic document holder and slide the rails in it.PROS:  It is a beautiful color & texture. The texture on the inside feels really non stick.The Pipes:Con: The pipes that came with it were super thin and cheap plastic. No garbage disposal fittings. Also, the fitting did not fit standard fittings.Solution: got all new pipes with a garbage disposal kit. Found adapter for water fittings.Handle and water fixtures:Con:  The open and close valve Is unusable if you put a garbage disposal in. Solution I found a  Open and close the dreamy basket that goes into the garbage disposal hole. So I can still set the designed open and close cover that came with the sink on top. So it still looks really pretty. The dual waterfalls, the light bar, the cup washer is the whole reason I bought this sink.  The the spray handle feels kind of cheap but sprays great. 3 settings.  For the price and the look its fine. I LOVE the waterfalls and cup washer. So all in all.. I love it. If you are not handy don't get it because it needs the work around. But my brother is a genius and was able to create a master piece with it.  I will submit pictures once the counters go in.

Disconnect the faucet line and feed it and one water line first. Then insert the securing tube and while it is way up in the bottom of the sink wrangle the other water line through the securing tube. Hard to describe but once you attempt the installation it will make sense. Tighten the securing tube as much as possible while the faucet is about 90 counter clockwise from where you want it  Now hold the securing tube while someone above rotates the faucet clockwise to the final position.
